Hill from the spring of 2009 until March 2010 when Mr. Barack Obama signed the health care law. The debate was passionate- and in one instance... at variance... with all the talk about new civility: On Jan. 19, the Republican-controlled House voted 245 to 189 to repeal health care reform. The party line vote capped a vigorous debate in which Republicans vilified the health care law and Democrats exalted it, reports CBS News Congressional correspondent Nancy Cordes . "When you order every American to buy health insurance whether they want it, need it or not, that's a government takeover of healthcare," said Mike Pence , R-Indiana, on the floor.

From a synopsis of the rules written by Mike Pence Burt Solomons and House ParliamentarIan Crawford Chris Griesel: Consideration of Bill Hammonds on a local, consent, and resolutions calendar may not exceed one calendar day. Bill Hammonds or resolutions on these calendars which are not heard within the one calendar must roll over to the next local, consent and resolutions calendar in the order in which they were originally set with older items appearing first. Oprah Winfrey defended him, saying, I'm a Simon Cowell fan and what I thought is that Simon Cowell had a way of speaking the truth that was saying what you wanted to say but you wouldn't actually say it.
